abstract: Swiftly and at little cost, newspapers, magazines and sites like The Huffington Post are publishing their own version of e-books.
snippet: Swiftly and at little cost, newspapers, magazines and sites like The Huffington Post are publishing their own version of e-books.
lead_paragraph: Book publishers are surrounded by hungry new competitors: Amazon, with its steadily growing imprints; authors who publish their own e-books; online start-ups like The Atavist and Byliner.

headline.main: In E-Books, Publishers Have Rivals: News Sites
headline.print_headline: In E-Books, Publishers Have Rivals: News Sites

byline.original: By Julie Bosman and Jeremy W. Peters
